conversation.thought: As Nursery_B, my true priority is E > B > C > D > A. In this round I received applications from C, D, and A. Among these, Parent_C is the highest on my list, so accepting C now secures a relatively strong match within my quota. While Parent_B (ranked higher than C) could potentially apply later, there is no guarantee they will, since their top choice is Nursery_A. Parent_E (my top) also is unlikely to apply because Nursery_B is last on their preference list. Therefore, accepting Parent_C is the best available choice and reduces the risk of ending unmatched or with a lower-priority parent.
